Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization

Class Encoder

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization.Encoder
public class Encoder extends Object
This is the Encoder class. This tracks the position of a motor of class DcMotorEx. The motor must have an encoder attached. It can also get changes in position.

    • Encoder

      public Encoder(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorEx setMotor)
      This creates a new Encoder from a DcMotorEx.
      Parameters:
      setMotor - the motor this will be tracking

  • Method Details

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(double setMultiplier)
      This sets the direction/multiplier of the Encoder. Setting 1 or -1 will make the Encoder track forward or in reverse, respectively. Any multiple of either one will scale the Encoder's output by that amount.
      Parameters:
      setMultiplier - the multiplier/direction to set

    • reset

      public void reset()
      This resets the Encoder's position and the current and previous position in the code.

    • update

      public void update()
      This updates the Encoder's tracked current position and previous position.

    • getMultiplier

      public double getMultiplier()
      This returns the multiplier/direction of the Encoder.
      Returns:
      returns the multiplier

    • getDeltaPosition

      public double getDeltaPosition()
      This returns the change in position from the previous position to the current position. One important thing to note is that this encoder does not track velocity, only change in position. This is because I am using a pose exponential method of localization, which doesn't need the velocity of the encoders. Velocity of the robot is calculated in the localizer using an elapsed time timer there.
      Returns:
      returns the change in position of the Encoder
